III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Eligibility requirements
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12504
Section • (3) An independent living home, staffed and operated by
Description the child placing agency, must be clean, safe, and
appropriate to the needs of the youth it serves.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The Methodist Children's Home Society is a licensed residential
program for youth. Since the summer of 2024, the center has
been infested with bedbugs. The center has tried to remedy the
issue, but the bedbugs are still present. The bedbugs crawl on the
furniture, couches, and other staff members.
Investigation Chief Administrator (CA), Independent Living supervisor (IL
supervisor) and Director of Foster Care Services were
interviewed together via Teams on December 12, 2024. IL
supervisor stated the agency first became aware they may have a
bed bug issue on August 23, 2024. A youth in the IL home was
working at Salvation Army and they believe he brought bed bugs
in because he had made comments about itching and having a
few bite marks upon returning from work.
IL Supervisor stated the agency contacted a company named
Erlich. Erlich entered the request for extermination services into
the system and it is contracted out to whatever exterminator in the
area accepts the bid and is willing to complete the job. Erlich
came out on August 26, 2024, and completed a walkthrough of
the bedrooms, common areas and checked all furniture. Bed bugs
were found to be in the youth’s bedroom only and were not found
in other locations. The agency bombed the building and Erlich did
an initial spray on August 29, 2024. On September 7, 2024, Erlich
brought dogs to the agency who are trained to detect bed bugs. At
that time, the company found 3 areas of concern. It was
recommended to spray, and the company indicated heat
treatment was not needed. Spray treatment was completed on
September 13, 2024, that included the 3 areas of concern. During
the week of September 16, 2024, the agency ripped out all the
carpet in the common areas and installed hardwood floors. All of
the furniture has also been replaced.
IL Supervisor stated there were no concerns for awhile since the
treatment was completed mid-September, however they were
2

notified of new concerns mid to late November. On November 20,
2024, the agency contacted Erlich again and they came out on
December 4, 2024, and brought the trained dogs onsite. It was
determined there were 3 bedrooms that were identified and an
area in the common area. On December 10, 2024, the agency
made arrangements to have an exterminator come out again. IL
Supervisor stated the agency is in the process of moving all youth
to a different cottage in order to fully exterminate Nichols cottage.
He stated the agency is doing preventative measures based on
recommendations from the exterminator such as going to the
laundromat to dry clothes on high heat prior to reentering the
building and alcohol spray bottles to spray clothes.
Documents reviewed:
• August 23, 2024: Initial bed bug notification. Work order
created. Erlich Pest Control contacted and reported to
Nichols Cottage to begin treatment. Erlich conducted a
follow up assessment on August 26, 2024, and found no
issues. August 29, 2024, agency sprayed and bombed.
September 7, 2024, bed bug dog walkthrough found 3
areas that needed attention. Determined spraying is
needed. Erlich Pest Control contacted again, and the
agency is awaiting a date.
• September 13, 2024, agency work order: removed current
flooring and replaced with new flooring.
• September 25, 2024, agency work order: replaced furniture
in common area.
• November 19, 2024, agency work order: contacted
exterminator to address bed bugs.
• Erlich Pest Control: Preparation requirements and follow up
steps for bed bug conventional service.
• December 9, 2024, Erlich Pest Control scope of service.
Indicates company will administer conventional bed bug
treatment on December 13, 2024, for all 10 bedrooms and
common areas of Nichols Building. In addition, company is
providing 10 active bed liners to be put on the beds.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance. The agency acknowledges
they began experiencing issues with bed bugs in late August
2024. Since initially becoming aware of the issue, they have
addressed the matter by hiring an exterminator several times. In
addition, they have followed recommendations provided by the
exterminator and taken proactive steps to replace all of the
flooring and furniture in common areas of the IL home. There is no
indication based on completed interviews and review of
3

documentation the agency has not adequately addressed the
issue.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
